key_points: Rudolph Giuliani transitioned from New York City Mayor and 'America's Mayor' to a controversial figure due to his legal troubles and association with Donald Trump.
Bernard Kerik, former NYC Police Commissioner, faced legal issues and a pardon from President Trump after a brief political appointment.
George W. Bush's presidency saw a surge in popularity post-9/11, leading to the War on Terrorism, but later retired to painting.
Richard Cheney, as Vice President, advocated for strong military action post-9/11 and has seen his daughter Liz Cheney become a controversial figure within the GOP.
Colin Powell, despite initially supporting the Iraq War, distanced himself from the Republican Party due to disagreements with its direction under Trump.
Condoleezza Rice transitioned from national security roles to academic positions at Stanford University.
John Ashcroft, as Attorney General, played a key role in the enactment of the USA PATRIOT Act before moving into lobbying and consulting.
John Yoo provided legal justification for war on terrorism tactics and continues to support strong presidential powers.
Khalid Sheikh Mohammed, the "principal architect of the 9/11 attacks," remains in Guantanamo with his trial repeatedly postponed.
Hamid Karzai's presidency saw attempts at unifying Afghanistan, but his term ended peacefully with power transition to Ashraf Ghani.
